title: Fiddle Rank 3 ultimate CD reduced by 50 seconds just to make him playable
body: What a fucking massive powercreep, I remember when people used to complain about Fiddle's CC and permasilence and now he needs a minute less CD on his ultimate just to compete with the other powercrept champions.

replies.body: Not really. It's just that his cc got nerfed over time and it is far easier to get rid of him atm, things like Taric ult and Janna ult completely remove him

Sorry but taric ulti is bad against Fiddlestick. It ll kick in by the time your entier team is dead and that is even if fiddlestick doesnt CC taric

those aren't even the problems {{champion:268}} can literally push him around you have to ban azir to play fiddle. I play fiddle stick quite a bit and i'll tell you that he has no damage outside of his ult. His ult is massive damage but while it's on CD he's just basically walking around trying to fear someone as the crow is too random. This makes him want to stand behind the ADC even. What's more his ult puts fiddlesticks in danger and if he is too low he basically can't ult because he'll die before he can {{item:3157}} aaand he can be interrupted. However if he get's an on your team is GG you're either {{summoner:4}} or wipe. His power budget is pretty retarted tbh, they need to readjust his damage take some from the ult but add some to the rest of the kit.

its not just CC.  Fiddle used to be fun JG, and his W used to be able to keep up with most dam 1v1 so he had some survivability.  Now, even if he has his W locked on he is dead in 1 second.  There is too much burst.  Reducing his CD time isn't going to make him viable either.  Fiddle ults in and either Zhonya's and you walk out of range, or doesn't and you destroy him before he can do much,

His gameplay is so binary and cancerous i would prefer it if they left him like this until he's reworked.  If he's ever going to become meta people are just going to complain about how braindead and unfun it is to not be able to get near him because he just clicks on you to cc.

his gameplay isn't binary though.

His gameplay is about finding a nearby out of vision spot to ult from, the ult channel and low range essentially require it, from there he needs to target someone with allies nearby for his crow to bounce but not so close that he is in immediate danger of being bursted or cc'd during his drain, which he needs to be completely immobile to use properly, of course assuring that he is near enough to his target so that his fear does not push his target out of his effective range.

His kit is essentially a kit all about near perfect positioning in exchange for a very good amount of damage on several targets and a whole lot of damage on one target.

I mean if that is binary then it is still better than all those champions that technically have a lot of options but realistically only use like two, or have so many options that they are impossible to counter with knowledge and good play.

The only non binary thing is his ult, and his ult has high cooldown. The rest of his kit is basically don't get into his cc range because there issen't shit you can do against him clicking on you. Also having to position and being carefull not to get bursted or cc'ed is not unique to fiddle.

positioning is not unique to fiddle, but fiddle specifically needs to stand absolutely still to get his damage off.

So fiddle needs to position even better. even kog has the ability to move without needing to directly hurt his damage output.
Malzaharand and MF also needs to stand still to do damage.

You are absolutely wrong on both accounts

Mf can deal a good amount of damage with auto attacks.

and malzahar's suppress (which is what causes him to stop moving) doesn't actually do damage. the pool created with it does, but the pool stays whether malz moves or not.
So we're going to pretend like fiddle's drain is his only damage but mf ult issen't. And malzahar still has to root himself in place to use it.
To be fair, Fiddle's ult isn't really as good as you're making it out to be. It's just an extra flash with a bit of damage.

625-1625 damage over 5s with a scaling of 2.25 AP over the whole thing is more than "a bit" of damage.  1.5 is a lot of time in League though and that delay means the damage is easy to avoid, especially when Zhonya is a common delivery method that prevents chasing.  Honestly if Fiddlesticks didn't have his R his kit wouldn't have good damage, he's pretty loaded onto his R.  Drain is good but easy to break, Crow bounce is good but often will only hit a target once and its maximum damage at 3 bounces on one person is 435 + 1.35 AP scaling.  He just isn't going to have kill threat unless R is delivered.

> that delay means the damage is easy to avoid

And will be healed up by redemption, shielded by locket from ether the tanks or supports, damage reduction thrown on the priority target, and if that's not enough fiddles will be forced to hourglass soon as he jumps in because of the amount of crowd control we have in games now these days.

Fiddlesticks jungle is a very situational champion, and I can tell you that this champ deals close to "no" damage unless you are over fed and you have the perfect setup, which almost never happens against good players (because they will know how to counter you, and that is very, very very easy to do, even if you are 10/0).

i hear you, but that wasn't really my point. the phrasing "bit of damage" felt kinda like a funny understatement given the context of speaking of the ability in a vacuum scenario

i know his ult's easily avoided, but just because the damage can be avoided doesn't make it a small amount of damage. it's avoided precisely _because_ it does so much damage. it's not killing anyone all on it's own, but you just don't really want to stand in fidd's ult.

if it was just a flash with a "bit of damage"  people wouldn't even bother running. if that's just a bit, i shudder to think what a "lot of damage" looks like

Fiddles shouldn't be viable. He has a toxic kit.

As with assassins, he's countered so fucking hard by vision.

You see him coming? Ward over that wall, OH HE'S CHARGING, RUN BOYS RUN!

Look at that, he just lost 75% of his damage because he whiffed ult.

The toxic part of Fiddle's kit isn't his ultimate, which is the only thing that requires skill in his kit.
It is just how horrible to face him with his Q and E. Nothing else, really.
Why? Because he has a lot of CC? So does Zac, Sej, and Mao but Riot won't touch them.
long duration point and click fear, and moderate duration point and click silence are pretty cancer compared to them.

It's not 'cancer', Fear range is not that high, and Fiddle is extremely squishy, he can't just run straight to you and fear.
There are a lot of mechanics in the game that counters Fear (and CCs) : QSS, Mikaels, Cleanse, Tenacity (mercurys, elixirs) and even some abilities like Alistar's R, Tristana's jump, and so on.
In fact, the fear is not instant by the way, it has wind up + travel time, you can always use a spell in between (Tristana Jump, Tristana R, or anything).
Most of those counters are not even team requirement, I mean that you can use them yourself to "counter-carry", so it's not especially good in solo Q.
QSS also bring MR, which is GREAT against Fiddle.

Source : >3k game with Fiddle @ Plat./Diam. elo.
To face him ? Just stay away from the creeps and he doesn't have ANY damage from E.

I mean this is not acceptable as counterplay
leave lane he wont hit you dafuq? :d

(1) If Fiddle spams E on the creeps to get some poke on you: first, it's random and it doesn't prioritize players. 
You'll get hit something like 7/10 times and you will at maximum take 1 bounce per E, which isn't big damage.
(It is very easy to avoid multiple bounces if dont stay near your very LOW hp creeps.)

(2) What I am trying to say is that: if you are not surrounded by your allies creeps, Fiddle he isn't a threat at all.
By example, if you meet him outside of the lane then he's totally free, you're not getting a kill with Fiddle with only 1 E bounce, ever.

Also, it is very common to play versus champions that doesn't allow you to be in your allies creeps...
When I play vs Lux, and she uses her AoE to push, I can't stay in my creeps, or I'll get poked aswell...

Oh, and when Rengar one shotted in sub milli-second, this isn't toxic ?

And by the way, as a Fiddlesticks player, Fiddle is exactly the type of champion (squishy+static with no escape) that suffer the most from 'toxic' champions, the difference with Fiddle is that you don't provide anything back to your team in return for being static and squishy.
Try wandering in the jungle with Fiddle when you're against Lee Sin, Kha'Zix, Sejuani (or anything else tbh) : you'll see the real definition of toxicity.

I think the main reason why Fiddle jungle felt out of favor was the jungle changes that made it impossible for him to clear effectively (no small stuff on blue and red buff). This buff could potentially make him playable, either in jungle or in mid. I am afraid of the called out jungle changes to come that should make jungling for mana intensive champions easier. If these are too big and Fiddle gets this buff, he might be just a little over-tuned. Not much though I think.
